responses.rationale: The segment describes symptoms and potential causes, not prices or economic metrics.
The segment discusses a potential future problem, not factual reporting of current prices or metrics.
The segment uses a metaphor ('collateral damage') but does not report prices or economic metrics.
The segment uses a vivid adjective ('voraciousness') and describes a classification ('pandemic'), not factual reporting of prices or metrics.
'infected and killed millions' reports a metric factually using standard verbs.
The segment introduces a topic, not factual reporting of prices or metrics.
'one case has been confirmed' reports a metric factually using a standard verb.
'totalling 650,000 poultry' reports a metric factually using a standard verb.
'an increase in the number of people... getting infected' reports a metric factually.
'include cases in at least six different states' reports a metric factually using a standard verb.
The segment describes symptoms, not prices or economic metrics.
'Over half of the over 900 human H5N1 cases reported... have resulted in death' reports metrics factually.
The segment describes symptoms, not prices or economic metrics.
The segment describes a symptom, not prices or economic metrics.
The segment contains explicit reassuring language ('risks... remain low'), not factual reporting of prices or metrics in the Q9 sense.
The segment discusses diseases linked to consumption, not prices or economic metrics.
'around four and a half percent of Americans are consuming raw milk' reports a metric factually.
The segment uses a vivid verb ('jumped') to describe the change in sales figures.
'Half the domestic cats... died' reports a metric factually using a standard verb.
'56 percent of bird flu cases detected in humans were fatal' reports a metric factually.
'total number of birds killed... to 22 million... number killed in Iowa to 13 million' reports metrics factually.
The segment describes a mechanism of spread, not prices or economic metrics.
The segment reports locations of cases, not prices or economic metrics.
'Iowa raises about 11.7 million turkeys annually' reports a metric factually using a standard verb.
'had 46 million chickens on farms' reports a metric factually using a standard verb.
